descriptionSet.description: On this image, an elephant can be seen lying in a bed covered with a red blanket, trying to switch off the light with his trunk.

titleSet.title: An elephant put off the lamp

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: On this image, an elephant can be seen lying in a bed covered with a red blanket, trying to switch off the light with his trunk. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: A large section of Priyaâ€™s collection includes commercial labels that were glued on to parcels of the textiles either imported from Britain or made in India . In order to attract (presumably unlettered) Indian buyers or to make them remember a particular brand, these textile labels feature an amazing richness and variety of images that may have been conceived by British artists and traders. The choice of images in these labels that were mostly printed in Glasgow and Manchester, the major centres of textile industries in Britain then, reflects an interesting and often intriguing blend of east and west: many Indian subjects and icons are illustrated in western styles and vice-versa, such as an image showing an Indian elephant lying in his European bed trying to switch off a lamp with its trunk! (Yousuf Saeed)(gs)

related hyperlink: Saeed, Yousuf 2010. "The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art at Tasveer Ghar. An Introduction" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/85/index.html last accessed 2011-04-22 (gs)
